body:
I posted issue #6170  and was satisfied with the "solution", but i'm not anymore.

I just logged to the linux virtual machine in my Windows PC that i was using to deploy for the remote server and the same files are missing. The difference is that bitcoind was not running, no bitcoin operations were being done at all. I just tried to run bitcoind and it warned i had no .conf. 

In both cases #6170 and in the virtual machine i was using ubuntu 12.04 and bitcoin latest version from ppa:bitcoin/bitcoin. That's odd.

Only these are left in /root/.bitcoin/
blocks  chainstate  database  db.log  debug.log

My personal computer is not compromised as i supposed my remote linux server was, my wallet on Windows is safe here with considerable amount of bitcoins.
title: Missing bitcoin.conf and wallet.dat out of nothing
